title: Dataset Schema
description: A JSON schema for a dataset file in the data catalog.

schema:image.title: Image URL
schema:image.description: URL for an image to be displayed in the data catalog. Choose an image that is related to the dataset's content.

dct:identifier.title: Dataset identifier
dct:identifier.description: Unique identifier for the dataset. If left empty, it is automatically assigned.

dct:description.title: Dataset description
dct:description.description: Description of the dataset. Should go into details about the dataset content and help a non-specialist to understand what is the dataset about.

dct:accessRights.title: Access rights
dct:accessRights.description: **Recommended**. Defines the accessibility of the dataset (e.g., public, internal, etc.). You can find more information here: DCAT-AP CH 3.0 – Access Rights Vocabulary.

dct:publisher.title: Publisher
dct:publisher.description: Federal Office responsible for the data object

dcat:contactPoint.title: Contact point
dcat:contactPoint.description: **Highly recommended**. Information for potential inquiries about the dataset.

dct:issued.title: Issued date
dct:issued.description: Date when the dataset was formally issued for the first time. If unknown, you may select the date of the first publication of this metadata.

dcatap:availability.title: Dataset availability
dcatap:availability.description: This property indicates how long it is planned to keep the Dataset available. You can find the available values here: Planned availability.

dct:accrualPeriodicity.title: Accrual periodicity
dct:accrualPeriodicity.description: **Recommended**. Defines the frequency with which dataset is updated (e.g., 'Annual'). More information here: Available frequencies.

dct:modified.title: Last modification date
dct:modified.description: **Recommended**. Modification date of the data in the dataset.

dcat:version.title: Version
dcat:version.description: The version indicator following a Major.Minor.Patch schema (example: 2.1.4).

prov:qualifiedAttribution.title: Affiliated persons
prov:qualifiedAttribution.description: List of affiliated people, their contact address and respective roles.

prov:agent.title: AdminDir Person ID
prov:agent.description: The AdminDir ID is shown as the URL slug of a person's AdminDir page. For example, on the page <https://admindir.verzeichnisse.admin.ch/person/p-2959456>, the AdminDir ID is `p-2959456`.

dcat:hadRole.title: Role
dcat:hadRole.description: Role this person has for this dataset.

bv:classification.title: Classification level
bv:classification.description: Classification level of the dataset according to the Swiss Informationssicherheitsgesetz, ISG. For information regarding the categorization, consult the Swiss Informationssicherheitsgesetz article 13

bv:personalData.title: Categorization DSG
bv:personalData.description: Categorization regarding the Swiss data protection act. For information regarding the categorization, consult the Swiss data protection act article 5.

bv:typeOfData.title: Data type
bv:typeOfData.description: Specifies the type of data in the dataset (master data, reference data, thematic data or unstructured data).

bv:archivalValue.title: Archival value
bv:archivalValue.description: **Recommended**. Indicates if this dataset has archival value and must be sent to the BAR.

bv:externalCatalogs.title: External catalogs
bv:externalCatalogs.description: External catalogs where the data object is published

dcat:catalog.title: Reference to external catalog
dcat:catalog.description: Reference to the external catalogs the data object should be pubished to. Adding a catalog here triggers metadata validation and an automatic push to the listed catalog.

dct:identifier.title: ID in the external catalog
dct:identifier.description: This field should be automatically filled at first publication with the ID assigned by the external catalog. It is a hidden field in the edit form.

dcat:theme.title: Dataset themes
dcat:theme.description: This attribute classifies the dataset into one or more broad thematics. Proper classification allow other users interested in the topic to find the dataset without knowing its name or description. Those are opendata.swiss themes, which are then mapped to EU themes. For the mapping, please consult this page.

dcat:landingPage.title: Landing page
dcat:landingPage.description: Landing page or homepage for the dataset.

dct:temporal.title: Temporal coverage
dct:temporal.description: Temporal coverage of the dataset. For example, the first and last measurement years for a timeseries.

dcat:start_date.title: Start date
dcat:start_date.description: Start date of the temporal coverage for the dataset.

dcat:end_date.title: End date
dcat:end_date.description: End date of the temporal coverage for the dataset.

dcatap:applicableLegislation.title: Applicable legislation
dcatap:applicableLegislation.description: The legislation that mandates or allows the creation or management of the dataset (as URI, e.g. https://www.fedlex.admin.ch/eli/oc/2022/491/de#art_5).

bv:retentionPeriod.title: Retention period
bv:retentionPeriod.description: Retention period for the dataset. That is, the time that the dataset must legally be available after the end of its active use.

dcat:catalog.title: Catalog
dcat:catalog.description: Indicates in which catalog this dataset is available.

prov:wasDerivedFrom.title: Derived from
prov:wasDerivedFrom.description: Links to other datasets from which this dataset was derived.

bv:geoIdentifier.title: Geo identifier
bv:geoIdentifier.description: Identifier for the dataset according to the GeoIV.

foaf:page.title: Related resources
foaf:page.description: Any related page, document or resource.

alias.title: Page alias
alias.description: Alias to be showed in the interface for this link.

uri.title: URL
uri.description: URL for the page, document or resource

bv:abrogation.title: Abrogation
bv:abrogation.description: Indicates when the dataset was abrogated or replaced.

bv:itSystem.title: IT system
bv:itSystem.description: Name of the IT system managing this dataset.

dcat:inSeries.title: In dataset series
dcat:inSeries.description: Reference to the dataset series this dataset is integrated into.

dct:replaces.title: Replaces
dct:replaces.description: ID of datasets replaced by this one

dcat:distribution.title: Distribution
dcat:distribution.description: Distribution info describing how and where to access the dataset. This class describes a specific, final, and ready-to-use format in which a dataset is made available to users. For example, the same data may be available as both a CSV file and an Excel file, each representing a separate distribution of the same dataset. Each distribution must be part of a dataset and should point to a reachable source (e.g. an URL for download). All distributions within a dataset must maintain the same level of timeliness across all channels. This means, for instance, that the 2021 CSV file should be published simultaneously with the Excel file, and vice versa.

dct:identifier.title: Distribution identifier
dct:identifier.description: Identifier for this distribution. If left empty, it will be automatically assigned.

dcat:accessURL.title: Access URL
dcat:accessURL.description: URL to a page for accessing this distribution. This must not be a direct download URL but, for example, a link to a webpage containing download links.

dcatap:availability.title: Distribution availability
dcatap:availability.description: This property indicates how long it is planned to keep the Distribution available. You can find the available values here: Planned availability.

dct:format.title: File format
dct:format.description: File format for this distribution (e.g., CSV, JSON).

dct:modified.title: Last modification date
dct:modified.description: Last modification date of the data in this distribution.

dcat:downloadURL.title: Download URL
dcat:downloadURL.description: Direct download URL of the distribution file. This link must directly point to the file.

dct:title.title: Distribution title
dct:title.description: Title for the distribution, in multiple languages.

dct:description.title: Distribution description
dct:description.description: Description for the distribution, in multiple languages.

dct:conformsTo.title: Conforms to
dct:conformsTo.description: Reference to a standard or specification the distribution conforms to.

dct:license.title: License
dct:license.description: License under which this distribution is released. This is mandatory for opendata.swiss publications.

dcat:accessService.title: Access service
dcat:accessService.description: Reference to data services used to provide access to the data.

dct:title.de: Beispieltitel, nicht länger als ein kurzer Satz
dct:title.fr: Titre d'exemple, pas plus long qu'une courte phrase
dct:title.it: Titolo d'esempio, non più lungo di una breve frase
dct:title.en: Example title, not longer than a short sentence

dct:description.de: Beispielbeschreibung. Eine Beschreibung eines Datensatzes darf deutlich länger sein als ein Titel, soll aber trotzdem überblickbar bleiben (3-10 Sätze). Beschreiben Sie damit den Datensatz, nicht die Thematik, nicht ein IT-System und nicht ihren Fachbereich. Dabei können sie auf Inhalt des Datensatzes eingehen, den Zweck etc.
dct:description.fr: Exemple de description. La description d'un jeu de données peut être nettement plus longue qu'un titre, mais doit rester claire (3 à 10 phrases). Décrivez ainsi le jeu de données, pas le thème, ni un système informatique, ni votre domaine d'expertise. Vous pouvez aborder le contenu du jeu de données, son objectif, etc.
dct:description.it: Esempio di descrizione. La descrizione di un dataset può essere decisamente più lunga di un titolo, ma deve rimanere chiara (3-10 frasi). Descrivi il dataset, non il tema, né un sistema informatico, né il tuo settore. Puoi parlare del contenuto del dataset, dello scopo, ecc.
dct:description.en: Example description. The description of a dataset can be significantly longer than a title, but it should remain comprehensible (3-10 sentences). Describe the dataset, not the topic, an IT system, or your field. You may discuss the content of the dataset, its purpose, etc.
